posts.title: Emergency Alert: Suspected Counterfeit Batch in Circulation
posts.summary: Do not consume batch PG-2026-991 until regulator verification is complete.
details: Field teams detected packaging mismatch and invalid QR responses.
Hospitals and pharmacies should isolate remaining stock immediately.
Patients should contact local health officials before continuing dosage from this batch.
posts.action: Verify batch number in PharmaGuard and report suspicious strips immediately.

posts.title: Why Substandard Antibiotics Are a Public Health Risk
posts.summary: Low-potency antibiotics can increase treatment failure and resistance.
details: Counterfeit antibiotics may have incorrect active ingredient concentration.
This can increase resistant infections and treatment costs.
Early reporting helps regulators stop spread quickly.
posts.action: Buy only from traceable sources and retain invoice + packaging evidence.
